resources.string: Najnoviji algoritam za napredne korisnike sa dinamiƒçkim/automatskim ISF-om
Max U/h privremeni Basal se mo≈æe postaviti na
Ova vrednost se naziva maksimalni bazal u OpenAPS kontekstu
Maksimalni bazalni IOB OpenAPS mo≈æe da isporuƒçi [U]
Ova vrednost se naziva Max IOB u OpenAPS kontekstu\nOvo je maksimalni insulin u [U] APS-u koji se mo≈æe isporuƒçi odjednom.
Nivo GUK ispod kojeg dolazi do suspenzije niske glukoze
Aktivirajte ili deaktivirajte implementaciju koja pokreƒáe petlju.
Create a new local profile from this Autotune Profile?
Set to a number, e.g. 160, which means when temp target is 160 mg/dL and High temptarget raises sensitivity=true, run 50%% basal at this level (120 = 75%%; 140 = 60%%).
AutoISF allows to adapt the insulin sensitivity factor (ISF) in various scenarios of glucose behaviour\n\nIt can also adapt SMB delivery settings
Set of options to increase the actual SMB size which can be delivered in situations where ISF was strengthened, i.e. fairly low ISF figure.\n\nUSE WITH CAUTION
Enable ISF adaptation by glucose behaviour

Similar to autosens_max this defines how strong ISF can become.

The default value 1.0 effectively shuts off this effect.

WARNING: Be extremely careful when using values above 2.5
Similar to autosens_min this defines how weak ISF can become.\n\nThe default value 1.0 effectively shuts off this effect.

This is the weight applied during longer lasting, elevated glucose plateaus and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose is below target and which weakens ISF thereby potentially reducing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose is above target and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose is rising and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose accelerates and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose decelerates and which weakens ISF thereby potentially reducing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
variable SMB delivery ratio, lower end\n(smb_delivery_ratio_min)
variable SMB delivery ratio, upper end\n(smb_delivery_ratio_max)
variable SMB delivery ratio, mapped glucose range\n(smb_delivery_ratio_bg_range)

Default value: 0.5 This is another key OpenAPS safety cap, and specifies what share of the total insulin required can be delivered as SMB. This is to prevent people from getting into dangerous territory by setting SMB requests from the caregivers phone at the same time. Increase this experimental value slowly and with caution.
Default value: 0.5 This is the lower end of a linearly increasing ratio rather than the fix value above.
Default value: 0.5 This is the upper end of a linearly increasing ratio rather than the fix value above.

Default value: 0. The linearly increasing SMB delivery ratio is mapped to the glucose range [target_bg, target_bg+bg_range].\nAt target_bg the SMB ratio is smb_delivery_ratio_min, at target_bg+bg_range it is smb_delivery_ratio_max\nWith 0 the linearly increasing SMB ratio is disabled and the fixed smb_delivery_ratio is used.
Default value: 1 This is another key OpenAPS safety cap, and specifies by what factor you can exceed the regular 120 maxSMB/maxUAM minutes. Increase this experimental value slowly and with caution.
Enable alternative activation of SMB depending on active target being even number

enabled ...
if active target(mmol/L) has even decimal
or active target(mg/dL) is even number

disabled otherwise
Percentage of maxIOB above which SMBs are disabled.\nDefault value: 100%\nWith 100% this feature is effectively disabled.
Max SMB value when BG is below 120
Small micro-boluses based on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
% of plugin reactivity between 6 PM and midnight
Morning Reactivity Percentage between midnight and 11 AM
Afternoon Reactivity Percentage between 12 PM and 6 PM
Increasing this value will increase the speed to send SMB when BG > 120
If you set a note on the action page with the word "meal", you will receive this value one time as a pre-bolus.
If you set a note on the action page with the word "highcarb", you will receive this pre-bolus one time.
Number of days to train the model
Number of minutes to train the data
Number of minutes to train the data for the ML engine
Number of epochs to train the data
Number of epochs to train the data
Learning rate to train the data
Learning rate to train the data
Number of times it will try before stopping the loop if it cannot get a satisfying result
Number of iterations to stop the loop
Increase this value above 100 if you want to receive more SMB. The opposite is true if you receive too much SMB.
DynISF factor to increase or decrease the number of SMB
DynISF adjustment factor for Meal Mode
This option will enable basal from the profile when BG is greater than 80 and delta is not negative.
Enable the possibility to delete one day in ML Training
This option enables step counting by receiving data from the watch instead of the phone.
Weight in kg to calculate basal
Average carbohydrates per meal. Estimated value, not exact
% of insulin required by AI for Meal Mode
Interval between SMB for Generic Meal Mode
DynISF adjustment factor for High Carb Mode
% of insulin required by AI for High Carb Mode
Interval between SMB for High Carb Mode
If you set a note on the action page with the word "snack", you will receive this pre-bolus one time.
DynISF adjustment factor for Snack Mode
% of insulin required by AI for Snack Mode
Interval between SMB for Snack Mode
DynISF adjustment factor for Sleep Mode
% of insulin required by AI for Sleep Mode
Interval between SMB for Sleep Mode
Child Mode (insulin needs lower than adult)
Max SMB value when BG is above 120
Lunch Mode Reactivity is % of insulin required for one SMB
Dinner Mode Reactivity % of insulin required for one SMB
Enable Learning Rate variable for better adjustment
DynISF Full Closed Loop via automatic detection
% of insulin required for SMB in FCL Mode
% of insulin required for one SMB
Number of AIMI analysis table lines in plugin and Loop tabs
Number of AIMI plugin/Loop table lines
Enable Auto Drive ‚Äì automatic meal detection ‚Äì EXPERIMENTAL
Autodrive will send a pre-bolus according to the rise detection conditions
Autodrive will send a pre-bolus according to the rise detection conditions
Autodrive will send a pre-bolus according to the rise detection conditions
Autodrive will send a pre-bolus according to the rise detection conditions
Below this ISF value, the condition to receive the pre-bolus is true
Above this value, the condition to receive the pre-bolus is true
Below this target, the condition is true to receive the autodrive pre-bolus
Above this BG value, the condition is true to receive the autodrive pre-bolus
Above this value, the condition is true to receive the autodrive pre-bolus
Minimum BG deviation for pre-bolus delivery
BG acceleration: if it is above this value, the condition for autodrive pre-bolus is true
Minimum BG acceleration for pre-bolus delivery

Used for early meal detection: BG > 100, predicted BG > 180. The idea is that when early detection occurs, a small SMB is sent to avoid negative IOB or late correction. This can be a good approach for a small snack.

Used for early meal detection: BG > 100, predicted BG > 180. The idea is that when early detection occurs, a small SMB is sent to avoid negative IOB or late correction. This can be a good approach for a small snack.

Used for early meal detection: BG > 100, predicted BG > 180. The idea is that when early detection occurs, a small SMB is sent to avoid negative IOB or late correction. This can be a good approach for a small snack.

Used for early meal detection: BG > 100, predicted BG > 180. The idea is that when early detection occurs, a small SMB is sent to avoid negative IOB or late correction. This can be a good approach for a small snack.
When an early meal is detected, AIMI runs a fixed basal for 30 minutes. Enter the hourly value of this basal (e.g., 4 units will deliver 2 units in 30 minutes)
Fixed basal 30 min if meal detected (U/h)
When an early meal is detected, AIMI runs a fixed basal for 30 minutes. Enter the hourly value of this basal (e.g., 4 units will deliver 2 units in 30 minutes)
Fixed basal 30 min if meal detected (U/h)
When an early meal is detected, AIMI runs a fixed basal for 30 minutes. Enter the hourly value of this basal (e.g., 4 units will deliver 2 units in 30 minutes)
Fixed basal 30 min if meal detected (U/h)
Fixed basal 30 min if meal detected (U/h)
When an early meal is detected, AIMI runs a fixed basal for 30 minutes. Enter the hourly value of this basal (e.g., 4 units will deliver 2 units in 30 minutes)

Enter only the first day of the cycle, format dd
During the first days of the cycle, this percentage will be applied as a basal reduction (studies show an average reduction of 5‚Äì10%)
First 5 days of cycle, basal reduction in %
During ovulation, several studies show the need to reduce SMB and basal by about 5%
The luteal phase requires about 8‚Äì15% more insulin
Luteal phase, set the % to apply on basal and SMB
